data.title: ‘Joni Mitchell Archives, Vol. 4: The Asylum Years (1976-1980)’ Out Oct. 4; Stream “Intro To Coyote / Coyote” from 1975
data.meta_description: The vaults will open again on Oct. 4 when Rhino Records adds to the ongoing series of Joni Mitchell recordings with 'Joni Mitchell Archives, Vol. 4: The Asylum Years (1976-1980).'
data.text:
Joni Mitchell Archives Vol. 4

The vaults will open again on Oct. 4 when Rhino Records adds to the ongoing series of Joni Mitchell recordings with Joni Mitchell Archives, Vol. 4: The Asylum Years (1976-1980).

Fully announced on Thursday, the set was previewed with “Intro to Coyote / Coyote,” recorded live at The Forum in Montreal, QC, Canada, Dec. 4, 1975:

In focus for this Volume 4 collection are the gold-certified Hejira [1976], the gold-certified double-LP Don Juan’s Reckless Daughter [1977], Mingus [1979], a collaboration with Charles Mingus, and live album Shadows and Light [1980].

This collection follows a string of recent archival dives into the vaults of the legendary singer/songwriter, including (among others)

Archives, Vol. 2: The Reprise Years 1968-1971

The Asylum Albums 1972–1975

Joni Mitchell Archives 3: Asylum Years (1972-1975)

Asylum Albums (1976-1980)
